title: From-scratch Onebit redesign proposal (deterministic “AI-like” expansion + wellness/burnout support; proposal-only)

requirements.text: Create a proposal document (no code changes) that redesigns Onebit from scratch while preserving the same core goal and session format, and proposes an expanded set of deterministic (rule-based) “AI-like” capabilities plus wellness/burnout/overwhelm support for user approval before implementation. Add the document to the repo as `frontend/REDESIGN_PROPOSAL.md`.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/REDESIGN_PROPOSAL.md` exists and is written in English.
The proposal explicitly states this is a proposal-only deliverable (no implementation yet).
The proposal re-evaluates the product from zero (does not assume current features are kept) while keeping the same Onebit goal and the same overall session journey shape.
The proposal explicitly commits to deterministic-only behavior (no external LLM / no web AI integrations) while still aiming for “AI-like” richness via rules, heuristics, and structured inputs.

requirements.text: In `frontend/REDESIGN_PROPOSAL.md`, include a complete end-to-end UX specification for the redesigned Onebit flow, showing each screen’s purpose, primary decision, required inputs, and outputs, and how the flow adapts when the user is stuck/overwhelmed/burned out. The flow must use both free text and structured inputs (“everything”) to better understand user state.

quotes: richer suggestions, more adaptive fallback tasks, smarter detection of stuck states, dynamic micro steps, understanding user's input in a better way.

acceptanceCriteria: The proposal defines the redesigned screens/steps and keeps “one primary decision per screen” as a guiding principle.
For each step, the proposal specifies: inputs (text + structured), deterministic processing, and user-facing outputs/copy tone guidelines (calm, respectful, non-gamified).

The proposal includes a deterministic model for: (a) richer suggestions, (b) adaptive fallback tasks, (c) stuck detection signals, (d) dynamic micro-step selection/generation rules, and (e) improved understanding of user input using combined text + structured signals.

The proposal defines explicit burnout/overwhelm handling: detection signals, recovery pathways, and “focus on the next one thing today” guidance, including normalization of failure and try-again paths.

requirements.text: In `frontend/REDESIGN_PROPOSAL.md`, include a feature inventory decision table that re-evaluates all current Onebit features from zero and marks each as: Keep, Modify, Remove, or Postpone. The proposal must explicitly remove the “Try Demo” / demo mode entrypoint and the 3 canned demo sessions from the intended product experience.

quotes: add more features into it like wellness for recovery or getting stuck as a new feature remove the try demo feature

acceptanceCriteria: The proposal includes a table that lists the existing features (e.g., demo mode, history, reflections, admin panel, accessibility controls, optional sync/auth) and indicates Keep/Modify/Remove/Postpone for each with one-sentence rationale.
Demo Mode / “Try Demo” is explicitly marked as Remove, with a short note describing what replaces its value (if anything) without adding new external integrations.
The proposal identifies any backend implications at a high level (data model needs, endpoints needed, migration risk), but does not require implementation yet.

constraints: Do not implement code changes in this build request; deliver proposal documentation only.
All user-facing text in the proposal must be in English.
Do not propose any external AI/LLM integration (OpenAI/Anthropic/etc.). Deterministic-only approaches only.
Respect platform constraints: single Motoko actor backend; React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query frontend; do not plan edits to immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Implementing the redesigned flow or features in code in this iteration.
Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is allowed).
Adding real-time features (WebSockets), push notifications, email/SMS, or external databases.
Live web browsing or web search as part of the app (proposal may reference best practices from general knowledge without claiming live research).
